etymologies: early 20th century; earliest use found in Annals of the New York Academy of Science. From scientific Latin Rhipidistia, group name + -an

definitions: Of or relating to the group Rhipidistia of extinct lobe-finned fishes, known from fossil remains of the Devonian, Carboniferous, and early Permian periods, and now usually regarded as the ancestors of all tetrapods.

notes.text: The rhipidistians have traditionally been regarded as crossopterygians. The taxon is now seen as paraphyletic, probably representing the crown group of all higher vertebrates.
